alert.note: Alert for Northeastern Brooks Range (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 14 at 3:23PM AKST until December 16 at 9:00PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM WEDNESDAY TO 9 PM AKST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Blowing snow and very cold wind chills expected. Plan on areas of poor visibilities and slick roadways to create difficult travel conditions at times. South winds gusting to 40 mph will cause areas of blowing and drifting snow. Visibility will be one half mile or less at times. Wind chills will be as cold as 50 below. * WHERE...near Passes. * WHEN...9 PM Wednesday to 9 PM Thursday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...South winds gusting as high as 40 mph will cause areas of blowing and drifting snow. Cold wind chills as low as 50 below zero will cause frostbite in as little as 10 minutes to exposed skin. Avalanches could occur in steep terrain. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Winter Weather Advisory for blowing snow means periods of blowing snow will cause travel difficulties. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
